titles.title: A bill to redesignate certain clinics of the Department of Veterans Affairs located in Montana.
A bill to redesignate certain clinics of the Department of Veterans Affairs located in Montana.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Senate Committee on Veterans' Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Mr. Roe (TN) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1282.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(Sec. 1) This bill redesignates Department of Veterans Affairs clinics in Montana located at:
2687 Palmer Street in Missoula as the "David J. Thatcher VA Clinic," 1775 Spring Creek Lane in Billings as the "Dr. Joseph Medicine Crow VA Clinic," and 1766 Majestic Lane in Billings as the "Benjamin Charles Steele VA Clinic." Any local public display of the name of the Dr. Joseph Medicine Crow Department of Veterans Affairs Clinic carried out by the United States or through the use of federal funds shall include both the English name, Dr. Joseph Medicine Crow, and the Crow name, Dakaak Baako.
